claim: In the 2015-2016 season, the four leagues with the most games were Spain LIGA BBVA, Italy Serie A, France Ligue 1, and England Premier League.
extra_info: in the 2015-2016 season refers to season = '2015/2016'; league with most games refers to League.name where MAX(COUNT(id))
reasoning: The database shows that in the 2015/2016 season, Spain LIGA BBVA, Italy Serie A, France Ligue 1, and England Premier League each had 380 games, tied for the most games among all leagues. The next highest leagues had only 306 games. The claim correctly identifies these four leagues as having the most games.

content.text: I'll verify this claim step by step. Let me start by exploring the database schema.

    id               INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,

content.text: Now let me query the top leagues by game count in the 2015/2016 season:

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/european_football_2.sqlite" "SELECT L.name, COUNT(M.id) as game_count FROM Match M JOIN League L ON M.league_id = L.id WHERE M.season = '2015/2016' GROUP BY L.name ORDER BY game_count DESC;"
input.description: Count games per league in 2015/2016 season

content.content:
Spain LIGA BBVA|380
Italy Serie A|380
France Ligue 1|380
England Premier League|380
Portugal Liga ZON Sagres|306
Netherlands Eredivisie|306
Germany 1. Bundesliga|306
Poland Ekstraklasa|240
Belgium Jupiler League|240
Scotland Premier League|228
Switzerland Super League|180

content.text:
The top four leagues by game count in the 2015/2016 season all have 380 games each:
1. Spain LIGA BBVA — 380
2. Italy Serie A — 380
3. France Ligue 1 — 380
4. England Premier League — 380

The claim states that these four leagues had the most games. The data confirms all four are tied at the top with 380 games each, and the next tier has only 306 games. The claim names exactly these four leagues as the top four.

The next highest leagues had only 306 games. The claim correctly identifies these four leagues as having the most games."}
